title: OpenCV: disable variants by default
body:
Previously, almost all of the optional variants in the OpenCV package were enabled by default. This results in long build times and a ton of dependencies:
```console
$ spack spec opencv
Input spec
--------------------------------
opencv

Concretized
--------------------------------
opencv@4.2.0%apple-clang@12.0.0+calib3d~contrib+core~cuda~cudacodec+dnn+eigen~fast-math+features2d+flann+gtk+highgui+imgproc~ipo+ipp+ipp_iw+jasper+java+jpeg+lapack+ml+opencl+opencl_svm+openclamdblas+openclamdfft+openmp+png~powerpc+pthreads_pf+python~qt+shared+stitching+superres+tiff+ts+video+videoio+videostab~vsx+vtk+zlib build_type=RelWithDebInfo cuda_arch=none arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
    ^ant@1.10.7%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
        ^jdk@12.0.1_12%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
    ^cmake@3.19.1%apple-clang@12.0.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
        ^ncurses@6.2%apple-clang@12.0.0~symlinks+termlib arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
            ^pkgconf@1.7.3%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
        ^openssl@1.1.1h%apple-clang@12.0.0+systemcerts arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
            ^perl@5.32.0%apple-clang@12.0.0+cpanm+shared+threads patches=517afe8ca1cb12f798f20b21583d91463fe3f4fa9244c6c8e054a92c8135da8f arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                ^berkeley-db@18.1.40%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                ^gdbm@1.18.1%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                    ^readline@8.0%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
            ^zlib@1.2.11%apple-clang@12.0.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
    ^eigen@3.3.8%apple-clang@12.0.0~ipo build_type=RelWithDebInfo patches=62590e9b33a8f72b608a72b87147a306e7cb20766ea53c6b8e0a183fa6cb7635 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
    ^ffmpeg@4.2.2%apple-clang@12.0.0~X~avresample+bzlib~drawtext+gpl~libaom~libmp3lame~libopenjpeg~libopus~libsnappy~libspeex~libssh~libvorbis~libwebp~libzmq~lzma~nonfree~openssl~sdl2+shared+version3 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64

            ^diffutils@3.7%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                ^libiconv@1.16%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
        ^yasm@1.3.0%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
    ^gtkplus@3.20.10%apple-clang@12.0.0~cups arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
        ^at-spi2-atk@2.34.2%apple-clang@12.0.0 buildtype=release arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
            ^at-spi2-core@2.38.0%apple-clang@12.0.0 buildtype=release arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64

                    ^bison@3.6.4%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                        ^help2man@1.47.11%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                        ^m4@1.4.18%apple-clang@12.0.0+sigsegv patches=3877ab548f88597ab2327a2230ee048d2d07ace1062efe81fc92e91b7f39cd00,c0a408fbffb7255fcc75e26bd8edab116fc81d216bfd18b473668b7739a4158e,fc9b61654a3ba1a8d6cd78ce087e7c96366c290bc8d2c299f09828d793b853c8 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64

```
By setting the default to False, we have way fewer deps:
```console
$ spack spec opencv
Input spec
--------------------------------
opencv

Concretized
--------------------------------
opencv@4.2.0%apple-clang@12.0.0~calib3d~contrib+core~cuda~cudacodec~dnn~eigen~fast-math~features2d~flann~gtk~highgui~imgproc~ipo~ipp~ipp_iw~jasper~java~jpeg~lapack~ml~opencl~opencl_svm~openclamdblas~openclamdfft~openmp~png~powerpc~pthreads_pf~python~qt+shared~stitching~superres~tiff~ts~video~videoio~videostab~vsx~vtk~zlib build_type=RelWithDebInfo cuda_arch=none arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
    ^cmake@3.19.1%apple-clang@12.0.0~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
        ^ncurses@6.2%apple-clang@12.0.0~symlinks+termlib arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
            ^pkgconf@1.7.3%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
        ^openssl@1.1.1h%apple-clang@12.0.0+systemcerts arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
            ^perl@5.32.0%apple-clang@12.0.0+cpanm+shared+threads patches=517afe8ca1cb12f798f20b21583d91463fe3f4fa9244c6c8e054a92c8135da8f arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                ^berkeley-db@18.1.40%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                ^gdbm@1.18.1%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
                    ^readline@8.0%apple-clang@12.0.0 arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
            ^zlib@1.2.11%apple-clang@12.0.0+optimize+pic+shared arch=darwin-catalina-x86_64
```
I've confirmed that this builds on macOS 10.15.6 with Apple Clang 12.0.0 and on Ubuntu 18.04 with GCC 7.5.0.

It would be good to check if this breaks any packages that depend on OpenCV:
```console
$ spack dependents opencv
bohrium  caffe  candle-benchmarks  cntk  lbann  mivisionx  mxnet  py-cinema-lib  py-mmcv  py-torch  saga-gis
```
The following people are listed as maintainers for those packages:
@EthanS94  @arjun-raj-kuppala  @bvanessen  @mfherbst  @srekolam

If any of your packages require specific OpenCV components, these should be explicitly specified in the `depends_on`.
